p: In summary, clinicians need to be extra cautious when applying antiviral drugs in patients with renal failure. They need to be alert to the possible serious neuropsychiatric symptoms, need to adjust dose according to the level of renal function, pay attention to treatment course and hydration, be fully aware of the possible neurotoxicity caused by these drugs, and be aware of the good prognosis after early identification and active intervention. In the meantime, since the clearance rate of these drugs is low when using peritoneal dialysis, these patients should be switched to hemodialysis.
